title: Fronti and Ozuna Bring Unfiltered Heat on ‚ÄòUn Kiss (Remix)‚Äô ‚Äî and an Orange¬†Lamborghini
summary: This Latin Remix of the Week delivers an explosive dose of uncensored trap.
body: In our Latin Remix of the Week series, we spotlight remixes that the  Billboard  Latin and  Billboard Espa√±ol  editors deem to be exceptional and distinct from the rest. We might not publish a review every week. This is our selection today. Fronti, one of Puerto Rico‚Äôs rising voices in m√∫sica urbana, enlists superstar Ozuna for the remix of his track ‚ÄúUn Kiss,‚Äù originally featured on his 2025 album El Diamond . While the original, produced by Dime Ecua and Arkey-O, showcased Fronti’s streetwise charisma, the remix amplifies the energy with Ozuna‚Äôs sly hooks. Backed by sleek trap production from RKO, the song finds Fronti spitting blunt verses about unfiltered desire, while Ozuna‚Äôs pre-chorus and hook add a playful yet polished contrast. ‚Äú Dale, beb√©, dame un kiss pa’ que lubri, vamo‚Äô a romper la ley, ‚Äù Ozuna croons. The chemistry between the two artists infuses the track with a feverish momentum. The music video sees the two artists flexing their star vibes and lyrical prowess, decked out in flashy jewelry and grills, set against neon-lit backdrops and an orange Lamborghini. It‚Äôs a fitting visual complement to a track brimming with lu‚Ä¶

body: New Music Latin is a compilation of the best new Latin songs and albums recommended by Billboard Latin and Billboard Espa√±ol editors. Check out this week‚Äôs picks below. Xavi & Carin Le√≥n, “La Morrita” (Socios Music) “La Morrita‚Äù (the young lady) has entered the chat, thanks to Xavi and Car√≠n Le√≥n’s first collaborative effort. Produced by Edgar Barrera, and co-written by Barrera, Xavi, Car√≠n, alongside Alex Hern√°ndez, Fabio Guti√©rrez, and Luis Mexia, the track finds the two Mexican forces delivering a vibrant, high-octane huapango that sets the stage for a bold love confession. With a cheeky and playful spirit, Xavi and Car√≠n not only breathe new life into the traditional huapango rhythm, but they also sing about modern-day romanticism: “I sent her flowers and a [Herm√®s] Kelly bag because she has a boyfriend and I want people to know/ That I like to spoil her, the young lady is really pretty,” goes the lyrics. ‚Äî INGRID FAJARDO Clarent, No Vuelve a Suceder (De Baller/Warner Music Latina) Clarent is staking his claim this 2026, delivering a 10-track EP that feels like a statement of intent ‚Äî raw, unapologetic, and fiercely self-assured. title: Kim Kardashian Has High Praise for a Ye Design: ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs Nothing Like‚Äô This Fashion¬†Item
summary: "I don‚Äôt know if they ever made these or just made them for me," the reality mogul said.
body: Kim Kardashian gave some major props to her ex-husband Ye (formerly Kanye West ) during her recent trip to Aspen, Colo., to kick off the new year. Related Kanye West and Kim Kardashian’s Relationship: A Timeline A Timeline of the Consequences Ye Has Faced for His ‘WLM’ Shirts & Antisemitic Hate Speech Ray J Has ‚ÄòNo Doubt‚Äô the Kardashians Are Racketeers ‚Äì And Says ChatGPT Agrees Kim K. recently posted a TikTok style video recapping her chic, wintery look while going out for a night in the popular ski destination town. The reality mogul rocked Roberto Cavalli leather pants with a golden corset and a luxe fur coat. She paired her outfit with Yeezy boot heels to complete the look , which perfectly matched her magenta pants. After paying the Yeezy design a compliment in the video, she said she wasn’t sure if the boots ever hit retail shelves or were a special custom design for just her. “Then I put it with these Yeezy boots,” Kim said. “I will say, there‚Äôs nothing like a Yeezy heel. I don‚Äôt know if they ever made these or just made them for me. I love when a shoe is tonal to the pant.” @kimkardashian Aspen Styling Vlog ‚Ä¶

body: Ariana Grande was all for getting splattered with as much blood as possible for Saturday Night Live ‘s spoof on Home Alone in December — but that was just one of many elaborate special effects the crew had to pull off to get everything just right. First of all, the costumes had to be just right, with Grande morphing into Home Alone ‘s Kevin McCallister in a perfect blonde wig and custom-sewn robe. Other cast members were dressed to look exactly like Kevin’s family. body: The Producers Guild of America has announced the nominees for the 37th Annual Producers Guild Awards. The awards will be presented on Saturday, Feb. 28, at the Fairmont Century Plaza in Los Angeles. Related Sphere’s ‘Wizard of Oz’ Hits New Box Office Milestone How Movies Make Music Fans: Billy Joel Documentary Shows How the Right Film Can Win New Audiences How ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Changed the Game For Netflix Nominees for the ceremony‚Äôs top honor, the Darryl F. Zanuck Award for Outstanding Producer of Theatrical Motion Pictures, are Bugonia, F1, Frankenstein, Hamnet, Marty Supreme, One Battle After Another, Sentimental Value , Sinners, Train Dreams and Weapons. The winner in this category has historically correlated closely with the Oscar winner for best picture. Billy Joel: And So It Goes, an acclaimed look at legendary Piano Man Billy Joel , is vying for outstanding producer of non-fiction television with aka Charlie Sheen, Mr. Scorsese, Pee-wee as Himself and SNL50: Beyond Saturday Night. KPop Demon Hunters, the megahit Netflix film that spawned one of the year‚Äôs biggest hits, HUNTR/X‚Äôs ‚ÄúGolden,‚Äù is nominated for outstanding producer‚Ä¶

title: ‚ÄòThere is Immense Potential‚Äô: Amid Maduro Turmoil, What Is the Future of Venezuela‚Äôs Music¬†Industry?
summary: Rawayana's Beto Montenegro and two Venezuelan music executives answer five business questions about the future of the industry amid major recent events.
body: The music industry in Venezuela ‚Äî like other sectors ‚Äî has suffered a notable decline in recent decades due to the country’s economic crisis, as well as the emigration of talent, insecurity and political censorship or self-censorship. Once a strategic destination for the touring market because of its geographic location, Venezuela has been largely excluded from the travel schedules of major international stars in recent years, although in 2024 there was a brief resurgence with concerts by artists like Maluma , Karol G and Luis Miguel . title: Flight Engineers Give NASA‚Äôs Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturn‚Äôs moon Titan, NASA‚Äôs Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nation‚Äôs most‚Ä¶
body: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturn‚Äôs moon Titan, NASA‚Äôs Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nation‚Äôs most advanced space simulation and testing laboratories. From left, Johns Hopkins APL engineers Tyler Radomsky and Felipe Ruiz install a rotor on the Dragonfly test model at the Transonic Dynamics Tunnel at NASA‚Äôs Langley Research Center in Virginia. NASA Set for launch in in 2028, the Dragonfly rotorcraft is being designed and built at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) in Laurel, Maryland, with contributions from organizations around the world. On arrival in 2034, Dragonfly will exploit Titan’s dense atmosphere and low gravity to fly to dozens of locations, exploring varied environments from organic equatorial dunes to an impact crater where liquid water and complex organic materials essential to life (at least as we know it) may have existed together. Aerodynamic testing When full rotorcraft integration and testing begins in February, the team will tap into a trove o‚Ä¶

title: I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds
summary: As booster manager for NASA‚Äôs SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynolds‚Äô path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttle‚Äôs Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy,‚Ä¶
body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds Dave Reynolds, the booster manager for SLS (Space Launch System), works inside the Next Generation Booster Avionics Mockup at NASA‚Äôs Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. Reynolds is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boosters for the rocket that carry NASA‚Äôs Orion spacecraft and astronauts to the Moon as part of the Artemis II mission. Credits: NASA As booster manager for NASA‚Äôs SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynolds‚Äô path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttle‚Äôs Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy, Utah, Reynolds remembers standing outside to watch the billowing smoke rise from booster tests at Northrop Grumman‚Äôs Promontory facility. Rockets were the backdrop of his childhood, and growing up during the shuttle missions sparked his fascination for space exploration. As the booster manager for the SLS, Dave is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boosters‚Äîwork that echoes the sense of significance that inspired him as a child to study spa‚Ä¶

title: NASA‚Äôs Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond
summary: A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet ‚Ä¶
body: 6 min read NASA‚Äôs Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat) , as NASA innovates with ambitious science missions that take low-cost, creative approaches to answering questions like, ‚ÄúHow does the universe work?‚Äù and ‚ÄúAre we alone?‚Äù All three missions are set to launch Jan. 11 on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Space Launch Complex 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. The launch window opens at 8:19 a.m. EST (5:19 a.m. PST). SpaceX will livestream the event. Artist‚Äôs concept of NASA‚Äôs Pandora mission, which will help scientists untangle the signals from the atmospheres of exoplanets ‚Äî worlds beyond our solar system ‚Äî and their stars. NASA‚Äôs Goddard Space Flight Center/Conceptual Image Lab Download high-resolution images from NASA’s Scientific Visualization Studio ‚ÄúPandora‚Äôs goal is to disentangle the atmospheric signals of plan‚Ä¶

title: Ganges Delta Under a Winter Shroud of Fog
summary: Low clouds blanketed the delta while parallel cloud bands rolled over the Bay of Bengal during a January cold wave.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Ganges Delta Under a Winter‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us January 6, 2026 Winter weather took hold across the Indo-Gangetic Plain in early January 2026, bringing dense fog and cold temperatures to much of the flat, fertile lands that span from Pakistan and northern India to Bangladesh. This image shows low-lying clouds over the delta on the morning of January 6, captured by the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) on NASA‚Äôs Terra satellite. Dense fog, particularly radiation fog , is common this time of year, forming when ground temperatures are cool, winds are light, and moisture is abundant near the surface. The meteorological departments of both Bangladesh and India called for moderate to very dense fog over the region that day amid an‚Ä¶

title: NASA to Provide Media with International Space Station Update Today
summary: NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agency‚Äôs headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medical‚Ä¶
body: Credit: NASA NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agency‚Äôs headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medical concern with a crew member currently living and working aboard the orbital laboratory. The matter involved a single crew member, who is stable . Due to medical privacy, it is not appropriate for NASA to share more details about the crew member. Participants in the news conference include: NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman Amit Kshatriya, associate administrator Dr. James Polk, chief health and medical officer, NASA Headquarters NASA will provide live coverage of the news conference on NASA+ , Amazon Prime , and the agency‚Äôs YouTube channel . Learn how to stream NASA content through a variety of online platforms, including social media. To participate in the news conference virtually or in-person, media must RSVP for details no later than one hour before the start of the event to the NASA Newsroom at: hq-media@mail.nasa.gov . NASA‚Äôs media credentialing policy is online. To l‚Ä¶

title: NASA Starts Up Gateway‚Äôs Power System for First Time
summary: Development continues on NASA‚Äôs Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can pr‚Ä¶
body: 1 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The primary structure of Gateway‚Äôs Power and Propulsion Element (PPE) undergoing assembly, integration, and testing at Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, on September 29, 2025. Lanteris Space Systems Development continues on NASA‚Äôs Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can provide the spacecraft with power, high-rate communications, attitude control, as well as the ability to maintain and maneuver between orbits. The Power and Propulsion Element is managed by NASA‚Äôs Glenn Research Center in Cleveland and built by industry partner Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, where teams have secured the element‚Äôs main electrical system inside protective exterior panels. On deck for installation at Lanteris Space Systems are three 12-kilowatt advanced electric propulsion system thrusters, manufactured by L3Harris, and four 6-kilowatt Busek-built BHT-6000 thrusters. Th‚Ä¶

summary: Michael Vaughan gives his thoughts on England's white-ball captain, Harry Brook, after he apologised for being involved in an altercation with a nightclub bouncer the night before a one-day international on the tour of New Zealand that preceded the Ashes.

title: Unloved in PE, ignored at top - what is cross country's future?
summary: Cross country evokes miserable school memories for many, while top athletes focus on Olympic disciplines instead - what is its future?

title: McCullum keen to remain as England head coach despite Ashes defeat
summary: Brendan McCullum says he's "not opposed" to making adjustments but says a complete overhaul of his approach won't be in store should he remain England coach, following their 4-1 Ashes series defeat to Australia down under.

title: 'We need to be smarter' - Stokes admits England must improve
summary: Ben Stokes says it's time for "some honest truths" to be shared amongst his team, following England's 4-1 Ashes series defeat in Australia.

title: England show fight but fall short as Australia seal 4-1 Ashes win
summary: After bowling England out for 342, Australia chase down their winning target of 160 with five wickets in hand to win the fifth Ashes Test on the final day in Sydney, sealing a 4-1 series win to retain the urn.

title: Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A Blue
summary: After a four-decade run, the massive, waterlogged berg is leaking meltwater and on the verge of disintegrating.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us December 26, 2025 The year that iceberg A-23A first broke away from Antarctica‚Äôs Filchner Ice Shelf , Ronald Reagan was president of the United States, and the movie Top Gun was setting box office records. Forty years later, the massive tabular berg‚Äîone of the largest and longest-lived bergs ever tracked by scientists‚Äîis sopping with blue meltwater and on the verge of complete disintegration as it drifts in the South Atlantic between the eastern tip of South America and South Georgia island. When it first detached from Antarctica in 1986, the berg was nearly twice the size of Rhode Island‚Äîabout 4,000 square kilometers. Estimates from the U.S. National Ice Center put the berg‚Äôs area at 1,182 squa‚Ä¶

summary: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

title: Carey hits four to seal five-wicket win for Australia
summary: Alex Carey secures victory in style for Australia, as he hits a four to seal a five-wicket win against England on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney, as Australia win the series 4-1.

title: 'He's a yard short!' - Labuschagne run out as England show late fight
summary: Marnus Labuschagne is run out for 37 after some excellent fielding from Matthew Potts as Australia fall to 121-5, chasing 160 to win on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'That has spun a mile' - Smith stunned by brilliant Jacks delivery
summary: Australia captain Steve Smith is left stunned as he's bowled by a brilliant delivery from Will Jacks for 12, leaving Australia on 92-3, needing 68 runs to win the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'It's had a shocker' - Snicko controversy strikes England again
summary: England find themselves on the wrong side of another controversial Snicko decision after Jake Weatherald is given not out despite there appearing to be a murmur on the Snicko technology, as the ball passes the bat - with Weatherald on 16 and Australia 33-0, chasing 160 to win the fifth and final As‚Ä¶

title: 'A wonderful innings' - Bethell's brilliant knock ended by Starc

title: Defensively, we are more stable than ever - Guardiola

title: 25 Years in Orbit: Science, Innovation, and the Future of Exploration
summary: NASA and its partners have supported humans continuously living and working in space since November 2000. A truly global endeavor, the International Space Station has been visited by more than 290 people from 26 countries and a variety of international and commercial spacecraft. The unique microgra‚Ä¶
body: NASA astronaut Jasmin Moghbeli retrieves media bags inside the International Space Station’s Kibo laboratory module for Emory University’s Project EAGLE investigation. NASA NASA and its partners have supported humans continuously living and working in space since November 2000. A truly global endeavor, the International Space Station has been visited by more than 290 people from 26 countries and a variety of international and commercial spacecraft. The unique microgravity laboratory has hosted more than 4,000 experiments from over 5,000 researchers from 110 countries. The space station also is facilitating the growth of a commercial market in low Earth orbit for research, technology development, and crew and cargo transportation.  After a quarter of century of human presence in orbit, the station remains a symbol of international cooperation and a proving ground for humanity‚Äôs next giant leaps to the Moon and, eventually, Mars.   September’s full Moon, the Harvest Moon, is photographed from the space station, placed in between exterior station hardware. NASA The microgravity environments aboard the space station unlocks discoveries that benefit lif‚Ä¶
